overview:
Aaron Hayes-Roth joined Meltwater New Ventures, the corporate development and corporate venture arm of Meltwater Group, in August 2009. He focuses on venture-stage investments in Software as a Service (SaaS), as well as sourcing, evaluation, and execution of M&A transactions, business development, and strategy for Meltwater Group.

Aaron led Meltwaterâ€™s investments in the B2B social media sector, including JitterJam (social CRM), IceRocket (blog search), and BuzzGain (social media monitoring). In addition, he secured strategic partnerships including iPressroom (digital media CMS).

Prior to Meltwater, Aaron worked for Towerview Capital Management, a private equity firm focused on leveraged buyouts and growth equity investments for lower middle-market companies. He evaluated investment opportunities in services and nutraceutical sectors.

Aaron also worked in deal sourcing and execution for Oak Knoll Capital, a micro-cap private investment firm, focusing in software, digital media and IT investments. Earlier in his career, Aaron worked in business development for Marlin Equity Partners and new client origination and deal structuring and execution for Benfield Group.

Aaron has an M.B.A. from UCLA Anderson School of Management, where he was a Deans List scholar and Knapp Venture Competition finalist, and a B.A. in Economics from Pomona College.
